intro: Lepidaploa chinchipensis, commonly known as the Chinese spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is native to China and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
